page.title: 07MIDDLETON RAIL TRUST,S.LEEDS
page.content: The publicity manager of the Middleton Railway Trust Ltd. came to talk to our school,and told us about the preservation of the railway.The Trust began in 1960 with the aim of buying and preserving Leeds built locomotives.In 1985 the Railway has 9 steam locomotives(Pecket 1 and 11, Matthew Murray, Windle, Danish, Henry de Lacey, Hawthorne and N.E.R.) and 6 diesel locomotives.The rolling stock includes cranes, goods and coal wagons and brake vans. Train services for visitors run on Saturdays, Sundays and Bank Holidays, and on some special occasions such as school steam days. The present cost is 60 pence return(adults) and 40 pence (children) and you can ride from the station to Middleton Woods where you can visit the park. All work on the railway is done by volunteers.
